topics.content: A rational number is a number that can be expressed in the form p/q where q is not zero.
Rational numbers follow properties such as closure, commutativity, associativity, and distributivity.
Exponents represent repeated multiplication of the same number.
The laws of exponents help simplify expressions involving powers.
The square of a number is obtained by multiplying the number by itself.
The square root of a number is a value that gives the original number when multiplied by itself.
The cube of a number is obtained by multiplying the number three times.
The cube root of a number is a value that gives the original number when multiplied three times.
Divisibility rules help determine whether a number is divisible by another number.
Number patterns help identify relationships among numbers.
An algebraic expression consists of variables, constants, and operations.
Like terms can be added or subtracted by combining their coefficients.
Factorisation is the process of expressing an expression as a product of its factors.
Common factors are numbers or variables that divide all terms of an expression.
A linear equation is an equation with variables having power one.
Solving a linear equation means finding the value of the variable that satisfies the equation.
Percentage represents a number as a fraction of 100.
Percentages are used in profit, loss, discount, and interest calculations.
Profit occurs when the selling price is greater than the cost price.
Loss occurs when the selling price is less than the cost price.
Compound interest is interest calculated on both the principal and previously earned interest.
Two quantities are in direct proportion if an increase in one results in an increase in the other.
Two quantities are in inverse proportion if an increase in one results in a decrease in the other.
Time and work problems involve calculating the time taken to complete tasks.
A polygon is a closed figure formed by line segments.
A quadrilateral is a polygon with four sides.
A parallelogram is a quadrilateral with opposite sides parallel and equal.
Geometrical construction involves drawing figures accurately using instruments.

chapters.chapter: Area of a Trapezium and a Polygon

topics.content: The area of a trapezium depends on the sum of parallel sides and height.
Three-dimensional figures have length, breadth, and height.

chapters.chapter: Volume and Surface Area of Solids

topics.content: Volume is the amount of space occupied by a solid.
Surface area is the total area of all the surfaces of a solid.
Data is information collected for analysis.
Mean, median, and mode are measures of central tendency.
Coordinate geometry uses coordinates to represent points on a plane.
A line graph represents data using points connected by straight lines.
A pie chart represents data in the form of a circle divided into sectors.
Probability measures the chance of an event occurring.
